entry.title: media_pipeline_integration_fuzzer: Integer-overflow in mov_read_seek
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=4867879125057536
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: media_pipeline_integration_fuzzer Job Type: libfuzzer_chrome_ubsan Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Integer-overflow Crash Address: Crash State: mov_read_seek av_seek_frame media::AVSeekFrame
Sanitizer: undefined (UBSAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_chrome_ubsan&range=857103:866748
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=4867879125057536
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Tests are failing: lens_webui_browsertest.cc(74): Value of: RunTestOnWebContents(web_contents, file, trigger, true)\n Actual: false (Mocha test failures detected in f...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): lens_webui_browsertest.cc(74): Value of: RunTestOnWebContents(web_contents, file, trigger, true)\n Actual: false (Mocha test failures detected in file: lens/overlay/region_selection_test.js, triggered by 'mocha.run()')\nExpected: true
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/LensOverlayTest.ManualRegionSelection
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/f6593f447632b1856c068dbc10f4d771
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Upgrade instrumented libraries from Focal to Noble
entry.content: This is a tracking issue for the bi-annual instrumented libraries upgrade. The latest Ubuntu LTS is releasing this month (24.04 Noble). The plan is to upgrade from 20.04 (past 22.04) to 24.04.

entry.title: roll libc++ again
entry.content:
We're kinda behind.
Issues:
* https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/github.com/llvm/llvm-project/libcxx.git/+/e3b94d0e5b86883fd77696bf10dc33ba250ba99b (2 revs after our currently pinned version) remove <queue> and <stack> includes from <format>. That apparently needs some cleanups. (Not quite clear why, we probably don't include <format> -- but maybe other libc++ headers do?)
* https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/86843 (10 or so revs newer than our pinned version) moved an include_next before the system header pragma, causing a "this is an extension" warning all over the place. I commented on the upstream PR.

entry.title: conformance/extensions/ext-blend-minmax.html segfaulting on Pixel 6 devices
entry.content:
Starting in [this build](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Android%20FYI%20Release%20(Pixel%206)/13165/infra), `conformance/extensions/ext-blend-minmax.html` has been consistently segfaulting on Pixel 6 devices:
``` I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main tombstone_11 created on 2024-04-08 22:52:00, about this long ago: 0:02:37 Device: 17261FDF6000LQ I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main Build fingerprint: 'google/oriole/oriole:13/TP1A.220624.021/eng.hypan.20221031.175238:userdebug/dev-keys' I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main Revision: 'PVT1.0' I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main pid: 24486, tid: 24504, name: CrGpuMain >>> org.chromium.chrome:privileged_process0 <<< I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR), fault addr 0x0000000000000000 I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main Stack Trace: I 22:54:42.324 4.003s Main RELADDR FUNCTION FILE:LINE I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 0000000000000000 <unknown> I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 0000000003f43378 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 000000000995309c gl::GLApiBase::glDrawArraysFn(unsigned int, int, int) ../../ui/gl/gl_bindings_autogen_gl.cc:3894:3 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 000000000a7f5520 gpu::gles2::GLES2DecoderPassthroughImpl::DoDrawArrays(unsigned int, int, int) ../../gpu/command_buffer/service/gles2_cmd_decoder_passthrough_doers.cc:1226:10 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 000000000a7e5128 gpu::error::Error gpu::gles2::GLES2DecoderPassthroughImpl::DoCommandsImpl<false>(unsigned int, void const volatile*, int, int*) ../../gpu/command_buffer/service/gles2_cmd_decoder_passthrough.cc:737:20 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 0000000009fbc014 gpu::CommandBufferService::Flush(int, gpu::AsyncAPIInterface*) ../../gpu/command_buffer/service/command_buffer_service.cc:232:35 I 22:54:42.325 4.003s Main 000000000a973230 gpu::CommandBufferStub::OnAsyncFlush(int, unsigned int, std::__Cr::vector<gpu::SyncToken, std::__Cr::allocator<gpu::SyncToken>> const&) ../../gpu/ipc/service/command_buffer_stub.cc:507:22 ```
The suspected culprit is https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/angle/angle/+/5415033 since it seems relevant to the extension being tested and it touches one of the files in the stack. Assigning to the CL author.
I will suppress the failures while this is investigated.

entry.title: WPT deleteAllCookies seems to not clear FedCM data
entry.content:
This test is failing: https://wpt.fyi/results/credential-management/fedcm-login-status-unknown.https.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned
This likely means that the deleteAllCookies call added in https://crrev.com/c/5403249 does not actually clear FedCM data. We should make it do that, to match the behavior of a user clearing cookies through the UI.

entry.title: Improve transition from site to tab group view
entry.content:
Right now, if you tap on the tab grid icon when browsing a website that is part of a group the animation shows the tab grid root for a split second and then animates in the tabs in that group.
Can we skip showing the root tab grid? or can we fade out the website to show the tab groups view behind it without animating the tab view at all?.

entry.title: Reset ipp_use_quic_ when network changes
entry.content: When the browser's network changes, we should re-evaluate the decision whether or not to use QUIC to talk to proxyA.

entry.title: Allow locally trusted root certificates to override CRS constraints
entry.content:
The Chrome Root Store has the ability to add additional constraints to roots now (issue 40941039), however these constraints may cause issues in some enterprise scenarios. We should allow enterprises to override this and trust the root without constraints. For example, with version constraints the enterprise may wish to trust the root before it is officially trusted, or continue trusting after trust was removed. With SCT constraints, an enterprise may wish to trust certificates that do not have SCTs, which would fail to verify with a SCTNotAfter constraint.
We can handle these cases by interpreting the certificate being locally trusted (either added to the local trust store, or from an enterprise policy) as a signal that it should be trusted without requiring the CRS constraints.

entry.title: Improve transition from tab group view to new tab page
entry.content: When a user is on the tab group view and taps on the + button at the top it looks like the NTP grows from the tab grid instead of from the group. Ideally, it should be the same animation as the one that happens when you open a new tab from the tab grid

entry.title: Add tab count as tab group title on tab group when the group has no name
entry.content:
https://screenshot.googleplex.com/85cmVrNr6BXdi7j
We should also add it to the group representation on the tab grid: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/uVEvYHngGnBXA6g and the context menus: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9MEHVGCpmSb5Bd9
But we should not add it to the tab strip representation since over there we optimize for space.

entry.title: Interpolation (gradients at least) with `none` channel values are wrong
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Visit https://codepen.io/romainmenke/pen/NWEaKpL 2. You expect to see only tints of blue and no pink or hue rotation
--------
1. Visit https://codepen.io/romainmenke/pen/xxejLQB?editors=1100 2. You expect to see the same shades in the top two gradients as in the 3rd gradient 3. You expect the mid point for the top three gradients to be the same as the middle rectangle at the bottom
# Problem Description None and powerless components are not implemented correct in interpolation. At least gradients are affected but likely also color-mix, transitions, animations, ....
# Summary Interpolation (gradients at least) with `none` channel values are wrong
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>CSS
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Canary \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Tapping on empty areas of the tab group view should close it
entry.content: We are using a blurred view on top of content (tab grid), just like on Spotlight, tapping on empty areas should close the tab group and take you to the tab group: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/B5AJh5nAJE68xjm

entry.title: Remove title "input field"
entry.content:
The gray box surrounding the group title makes it look like an input field. If it doesn't have the same functionality it feels broken.
We should remove it and align the title with the content beneath: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/88bYz2qKo76wPNK
